page.title: 03ELVASTON CASTLE COUNTRY PARK
page.content:
Elvaston Castle Country Park is a delightful country park in which to spend your free time.It is situated 5 miles south of Derby. The present house known as Elvaston Castle was built by James Wyatt for the Harrington family in the early 19th century.The house stands in over 200 acres of wood and park land. In 1969 the house and grounds were bought by Derbyshire County Council for use as a country park.
If you like to go on an outing you will like Elvaston Castle to spend your free time. There are lots of things to do. If you are out for a quiet afternoon a slow leisurely stroll around the Olde English Gardens might be a nice idea. The gardens are one of the main attractions.
